stem: After a deep laceration across the distal forearm, a patient cannot oppose the thumb and has sensory loss over the palmar surface of digits 1â€“3. Which additional motor deficit is expected?

choices.A: Weak flexion of digits 2 and 3 at the proximal interphalangeal joints
choices.B: Inability to flex the distal interphalangeal joint of the index finger

rationale_correct: Median nerve laceration at the distal forearm denervates flexor digitorum superficialis, weakening PIP flexion of digits 2 and 3 along with thenar function and palmar sensation.

rationale_distractors.B: DIP flexion of the index finger is mediated by the anterior interosseous nerve more proximally; it may be intact if spared.
rationale_distractors.C: Wrist extension is radial nerve mediated.
rationale_distractors.D: Thumb adduction is ulnar nerve dependent (adductor pollicis).
rationale_distractors.E: Abduction of digits 4 and 5 depends on the ulnar nerve (interossei).
